Reviews.Title: “Poor standard, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: jdavies2001
Reviews.Content: Not a great Travelodge, pretty run down and we had quite a stained, dirty room with a curtain that fell off its pole. Staff friendly enough but hotel simply tired and a bit grotty. Can't fault location, just needs a major revamp. Premier Inn in Buckhurst Hill miles better for similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just the job”
Reviews.Author: bikesbmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we were visiting London, the hotel location is excellent for transport into the centre of London, just a 5 minute walk from Snaresbrook underground station. and close to some very nice pubs, shops and restaurants in Wanstead high street, there is a pub / restaurant next door which is nice also. The pub also serve's breakfast although we did not eat there, the rooms were clean and spacious, we had a family room as there was three of us. and as we booked it in advance it was a great rate of £25, normally the rooms are around the £75 mark. Our room was on the ground floor and contrary to other reviews we did not here the tube line at all. Just one point to note though there is no baths in the rooms just showers, but these are larger than a normal shower cubicle and are very nice. The staff we encountered were all very friendly and were only to willing to help. So all in all a very pleasent stay

Reviews.Title: “Artwork on walls in a Travelodge?”
Reviews.Author: Rainbows75
Reviews.Content: I booked this six months in advance and paid just £19.00 per family room (2) for a couple of days between Christmas and New Year, as we were visiting family. I was surprised at how clean and decorative this little Travelodge is. Although Central Line passed the back of the hotel, we didn't notice it that much. The receptionist was very helpful and available all the time we were there. Only thing that I have mentioned to Travelodge is that it is not signposted well enough to be able to see it from the busy road, so we went past it and had to turn around. The car park was well-lit and felt secure enough to leave the car overnight. I would certainly book this Travelodge again, but you'd have to book early to get a good deal! It was easy to walk into Snaresbrook the next morning, leaving the car where it was and getting breakfast from a local cafe. The surrounding area is very pleasant and an evening meal is not hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jillip
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advanced and paid £78.75 per night for 2 nights. When we arrived there was not a room for us!!! So we never got to stay here. We only booked this hotel for its parking and close proximity to the underground as we came to London for our sons wedding and had no intention of using the car. Instead we had to stay at a Travelodge in Chigwell where the underground was nearly a mile away. We had to re arrange all of our plans for the wedding and use the car. For all of this inconvenience Travelodge gave us a measly £50.00 voucher!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: sbarrett91
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews after booking I didn't know what to expect, well I expected noisy pipes like everyone seems to of said but I didn't hear a peep! We were greeted by a lovely female receptionist who made us feel very welcome (unlike liverpool street travelodge!) and our room was clean, tidy and quiet. We had a great nights sleep ater watching 'Shrek the Musical' at The Theatre Royal, which by the way is well worth it!! We will defintely be using this travelodge again. Only thing I will say is that a vending machine selling the usual shampoo's and shower gels etc would be useful!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: catrinheledd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay - your usual travelodge. Rooms are very basic, we stayed for 5 nights, not once did we have clean sheets, but did get towels each day, although there were two of us staying we only got towels for one!! We had no toilet roll given to us as they 'ran out' for the whole week!! The corridor has a strong smell of weed/dope on the ground floor - you could get high coming in and out of the hotel. Not ideal for children. Reception staff (the males ones) were rude and unhelpful. Toby carvey next door was awful, staff were miserable and told us food was not being served when it was. breakfast is served to you in a bag outside your room at 7:00 if you want it - school packed lunch style. Hotel is extremely noisy, did not sleep a full night at all while we were there. The pipes are noisy, therefore if next door or upstairs/downstairs are having a shower you get woken up!! The location on the other hand is excellent, walking distance to a small tesco (convenient to buy toilet roll), and a boots, newsagent and a lovely chinese restraunt around the corner. Tube station is listerally a 2 minute walk away and around 20 mins from oxford street where all the main shops are. Enough parking if you are going to drive. Okay for staying for one night, not any longer! I'm a student therefore not fussy and do not expect much from places!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Baileygreen
Reviews.Content: Had free night's stay to use due to very noisy plumbing on previous visit. Was told in writing this could be used in conjunction with three nights for two offer. Total cost would be one night. Hotel told me - and I did ask them to clarify - they will not honour three for two deal booked with inkeeper's lodge they c took over. Receptionist and cleaner as helpful as they could be considering supervisor would not speak to me. No one in authority did even after I went to Internet cafe and checked both sites which both stated deal should be honoured and asked for this info to be passed on. Have complained to travelodge using on line form. Did receive email not related to my problem! No apology or explanation or refund. Attitude of hotel appalling, management could not care less. Room clean although plumbing still a bit noisy. Do not expect this hotel to honour any deals-double check the price before arrival. If anything goes wrong with your booking no one in authority will even speak to you on the telephone (I tried) let alone in person.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, but needs a few things being done.”
Reviews.Author: MidnightGuard
Reviews.Content: First note â€“ itâ€™s now been taken over by Travelodge. Negatives: The bathroom lights were temperamental â€“ occasionally worked. When next door are having a shower, the pipes vibrate & itâ€™s really loud too â€“ especially when theyâ€™re showering at 1 in the morning. Breakfast was in a bag each day outside your door at 07:00. Inside the bag were orange juice, croissant, jam, cereals, chocolate muffin & long-life milk. If you like that type of thing, itâ€™s perfect for you â€“ itâ€™s just not what I expected. Only the jam flavours vary & not the cereals. (Warning to Smartphone users) I never used the Wi-Fi, due to having 3G â€“ hated the fact that every time I connected to the internet a log-in page would pop up. It does get a bit tedious after a while. Positives: Location - 2 minute walk from Underground & the surrounding area is quiet too. The price was cheap (Approximately Â£250 for 5 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: neilbailey23
Reviews.Content: Room dingy, stain on bed sheet. The springs had gone on both twin beds and should have been replaced a least a year ago. Breakfast of poor quality, I also got into an argument with the carvery staff over the pathetic beef and turkey leftovers which they refused to replace. I've stayed in a few innkeepers over the last few years and have liked and recommended them. However the Borehamwood one we stayed in last year was poor and this was even worse. So my business will be going to the professionals next time rather than the ametuerish operation which Innkeepers seem to have become.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: stuffwelike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Innkeepers Lodge back in April May 2007, selected due to close proximity to family. We found it reasonable then and well maintained. The second time we stayed in December 2007/January2008, we noticed that in the few months since our first visit, the place had gone downhill and there was an uncaring attitude of staff. The auto closing and locking security door to the rooms was not working â€“ a couple of weeks later one of the bar staff attempted to fix the door at the front of the building but when I opened this a few minutes later a large bar of metal fell down and narrowly missed hitting me in the head. Obviously some cost saving attempted by not employing someone qualified to do the job. Breakfasts are included in room charge â€“ many days we didnâ€™t bother going to breakfast as the standard had fallen. There were two particularly bad mornings with no tea bags, no bread, no jams, cheese etc, no juice, no plates and out of date yoghurt which was not kept chilled. The bowls, cutlery and plates (if there are any there) are ALWAYS dirty. There always appear to be staff around but no one is ever doing very much. The breakfast staff are also housekeeping staff and donâ€™t appear to have had training in either. Check in: It can take ages to get served as you have to wait at the bar to check in. A few times we have arrived at this hotel at 8pm at night to find that the requested pullout bed was not made up. I have had to go to the pub to request toilet paper, bedding, towels and pillows at 9pm at night and then had to make my daughterâ€™s bed. The duvets and pillows are of very poor quality. The beds are cheap and lumpy with springs poking out, the pillows are flat (and they only give you one each). I always request extra pillows, but sometimes there just arenâ€™t any, so Iâ€™ve had to fold up hand towels and put them inside the pillowcase. Many times Iâ€™ve been given the key to the housekeeping rooms to help myself to my own pillows, towels, bedding because the bar staff are busy and I donâ€™t want to wait till they can come down to the rooms to get what I've requested. In a room with 2 adults and 2 children we were seldom given four bath towels. After one housekeeping session we had one bath towel and 6 hand towels for 4 people. There are huge numbers of fire doors in this place and they slam loudly whenever anyone enters or leaves their room, as do the rooms to the doors â€“ I was woken many times every night. Bedside lights were broken, handwash containers broken off walls (these had not been re-attached to the walls since our previous stay in April), TV remote control not working, mould in shower cubicle (easily remedied by application of mould remover). The bathroom would benefit from a heated towel rail as the room was cold and the towels stayed wet even though they were small and thin. There's not much room for four wet bath towels. There is an electric wall heater on the wall so you couldnâ€™t dry anything on the radiator. Walls are very thin â€“ I could hear the person next door turning their light switch off and on and flushing the toilet. Xmas eve we had a child next door screaming all night and someone above us who was thumping around on the floor all night - sounded like they were moving furniture - another sleepless night in this place. Rooms are very small, not recommended for more than two people, or perhaps a family with one small child. This hotel appears to be a haunt for travelling workmen who leave early in the morning with lots of door slamming. Pub is OK but the glasses are grubby. Now that smoking is not allowed inside the pub, there are cigarette butts all over the ground outside and in the planters. The beer garden is always full of dirty plates, food scraps, litter and empty glasses. I recommend this hotel for anyone who sleeps without a pillow and is deaf or a very sound sleeper. A miserable stay in a shabby noisy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tourists In London... STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jesiqa
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay over in London to celebrate my partner's birthday. After trawling through hundreds of hotel websites who wanted Â£150 per night, we came across the Innkeepers lodge who offer sunday night free if you stay friday and saturday, at Â£75 per night we booked it straight away. Continental breakfast was also included in the price, which you don't find at many other places. Upon arriving at 4pm to check in we found the cutest little building snuggled into a quiet corner of Snaresbrook just off a busy road. Check in took less than a minute and the staff were more than happy to help with anything. The hotel building is extremely secure. You need an electric key to get into 2 main doors and then another to enter your room. Staying in London I feel security is of the utmost importance. The room itself was a gem. Tidied to tee and the most spacious one we've ever stayed in. It was perfectly heated, with plenty of storage space. They'd also provided a bottle of champagne on ice and some helium balloons, which i'd previously rung up about. Although that extra tough did cost an extra Â£40 it was well worth it. The facilities are also excellent with a Tv offering 10 channels including 3 sky sports, sky news and sky 1. The bathroom was immaculate and the room was cleaned every day unless we left a note on our door. The location couldn't be any better. Literally 1 minute walk from a busy underground and 3 bus stops close by. Also just across the road is Snaresbrook crown court and a wonderful lake, which makes for great pictures. Next to the underground station is a small arcade of shops, most of which are closed at the weekend, or closed full stop but if the Toby Cavery doesn't take your fancy there's a lovely chinese restaurant. The pub was lovely, if you wanted just a few drinks or some pub food it was really quiet and a nice environment. The Carvery was always packed, but what else do you expect with the quality of food at such great prices. Breakfast also took place in the pub which was so relaxed in the morning, we were often the only ones in there and got the best seat in the house. You could chose from bagels, toast, pastries, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate... and the best bit is you could have as much as you like! Overall our stay was highly enjoyable. The only bad bit was the view (a close up of a brick wall) but who goes to London to just look out the hotel window!!!???!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for london visit”
Reviews.Author: sr100
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 3 times now and will stay again on future visits to the capital. The pub has a good carvery and there is an excellent italian restaurant just round the corner. The room is always spotless and we havent encountered any problems on any of our stays. sometimes you can hear a little noise but take earplugs and you will be ok. This lodge is excellent value for money for 2 adults and 2 children including breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Snaresbrook
HotelInfo.Address: 73 Hollybush Hill | Snaresbrook, London E11 1PE, England (Formerly London Snaresbrook)
